(vertigo) Paroymsal Positional Vertigo.first_aid: Sit or lie down immediately to prevent falls. Avoid sudden head movements. Rest until dizziness subsides.

AIDS.first_aid: Seek immediate medical care. Take prescribed antiretroviral medications without delay.

Acne.first_aid: Clean skin gently, avoid picking pimples. Over-the-counter creams may help.

Alcoholic hepatitis.first_aid: Stop alcohol immediately. Hydrate well and seek urgent medical attention.

Allergy.first_aid: Remove allergen exposure, take antihistamines. If breathing difficulty occurs, seek urgent care.

Arthritis.first_aid: Rest the joints, use warm compresses, and avoid strain. Over-the-counter pain relievers can help.

Bronchial Asthma.first_aid: Use inhaler if available. Sit upright, stay calm, avoid triggers like smoke. Seek emergency help if breathing worsens.

Cervical spondylosis.first_aid: Apply warm compress, maintain good posture, avoid heavy lifting.

Chicken pox.first_aid: Rest, drink fluids, avoid scratching blisters, take calamine lotion for itching.

Chronic cholestasis.first_aid: Seek medical care immediately, avoid alcohol, and maintain hydration.

Common Cold.first_aid: Stay hydrated, rest, use warm fluids and steam inhalation.

Dengue.first_aid: Drink plenty of fluids, rest, avoid aspirin. Seek immediate care if bleeding or severe symptoms occur.

Diabetes.first_aid: Monitor blood sugar, eat regular meals, and take prescribed medicines. Seek care if severe hypo/hyperglycemia occurs.

Dimorphic hemmorhoids(piles).first_aid: Increase fiber intake, drink water, use sitz baths for relief.

Drug Reaction.first_aid: Stop the suspected medication. Take antihistamines if rash or itching. Seek emergency help if breathing difficulty occurs.

Fungal infection.first_aid: Keep area dry and clean, use antifungal creams, avoid scratching.

GERD.first_aid: Avoid heavy meals, alcohol, and lying down after eating. Take antacids if needed.

Gastroenteritis.first_aid: Drink oral rehydration solution (ORS), rest, and avoid oily foods.

Heart attack.first_aid: Call emergency services immediately. Chew an aspirin if not allergic, stay calm and rest.

Hepatitis A.first_aid: Rest, hydrate, avoid alcohol and heavy foods. Seek doctor for liver care.

Hepatitis B.first_aid: Rest, hydrate, avoid alcohol. Seek doctor for antiviral treatment.

Hepatitis C.first_aid: Rest, hydrate, avoid alcohol. Seek specialist care.

Hepatitis D.first_aid: Seek hospital care urgently. Avoid alcohol. Monitor liver function.

Hepatitis E.first_aid: Drink safe water, hydrate, rest, and seek medical care.

Hypertension.first_aid: Rest, avoid stress, avoid high salt foods. Take prescribed medications on time.

Hyperthyroidism.first_aid: Avoid stimulants like coffee. Take medicines as prescribed. Seek doctor if severe symptoms.

Hypoglycemia.first_aid: Give sugar or sweet drink immediately. Seek urgent care if unconscious.

Hypothyroidism.first_aid: Take thyroid medicines as prescribed, maintain healthy diet.

Impetigo.first_aid: Wash area gently, apply antibiotic ointment. Avoid sharing towels.

Jaundice.first_aid: Rest, hydrate, avoid alcohol and fatty foods. Seek doctor for diagnosis.

Malaria.first_aid: Drink plenty of fluids, rest, and avoid mosquito bites. Seek medical attention promptly for anti-malarial treatment.

Migraine.first_aid: Rest in a quiet dark room, stay hydrated, avoid loud noises and bright lights.

Osteoarthristis.first_aid: Do gentle exercises, use warm compresses, avoid overstraining joints.

Paralysis (brain hemorrhage).first_aid: Call emergency services immediately, do not move patient unnecessarily.

Peptic ulcer diseae.first_aid: Avoid spicy food, alcohol, smoking. Take antacids if needed.

Pneumonia.first_aid: Rest, hydrate, seek doctor promptly for antibiotics.

Psoriasis.first_aid: Moisturize skin, avoid scratching, use medicated creams.

Tuberculosis.first_aid: Wear a mask to prevent spread, seek doctor immediately for TB medicines.

Typhoid.first_aid: Drink ORS, rest, maintain hygiene. Seek doctor for antibiotics.

Urinary tract infection.first_aid: Drink lots of water, avoid caffeine, seek doctor for antibiotics.

Varicose veins.first_aid: Elevate legs, wear compression stockings, avoid long standing.
